item.title: BGMEA, DBP announce cooperation to develop Digital Factory Passport
item.description:
Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BGMEA) will develop an AI-enabled ESG compliance framework, namely 'Digital Factory Passport (DFP),' to strengthen transparency, accountability, and global competitiveness across the country's garment industry.
In this connection,

item.title: Remittance inflow witnesses 14.9pc growth till Oct 5
item.description: Inflow of remittances witnessed 14.9 percent (pc) growth, reaching US$8,008 million during the period from July 1 to October 5, 2025 which was $6,967 million during the same period of the previous fiscal year. According to the latest data of Bangladesh Bank (BB) issued on Monday, during the first

item.title: No option except holding a fair election: CEC
item.description: Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin on Monday said there is no alternative before the Election Commission to arranging the next national election in a fair manner in this critical time as it may shape the future of the country. “This election is probably going to shape the future of

item.title: France in crisis as government quits just hours after being appointed
item.description: France's new Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu and his government resigned on Monday, hours after Lecornu announced his cabinet line-up, in a major deepening of France's political crisis that drove stocks and the euro sharply lower. The swift, unexpected resignation came after allies and foes alike

item.title: Eli Lilly to invest over $1 billion in India to expand manufacturing capacity
item.description: Eli Lilly (LLY.N) will invest more than $1 billion in India in the coming years to boost manufacturing and supply through local drugmakers, the company said on Monday, as it seeks to tap into skilled workforce to bolster its global manufacturing expansion. The collaborations aim to increase the av

item.title: Negotiators gather for Gaza talks, mediators caution deal may not be swift
item.description: Hamas officials were in Egypt on Monday ahead of talks with Israel that the US hopes will bring a halt to war in Gaza and release of hostages despite contentious issues like disarmament of the Palestinian militant group under Donald Trump's plan. Talks were set to begin as the war reaches its two-

item.title: 3 more die of dengue; 782 hospitalised
item.description: Three more deaths from dengue were reported in the 24 hours till Monday morning as Bangladesh continues to grapple with a surge in infections. With the latest fatalities, the total number of deaths from the Qmosquito-borne disease in Bangladesh has risen to 215 this year, according to the Director

item.title: Army Chief’s remarks distorted by malicious groups: ISPR
item.description: The Army Chief has not made any statement about giving indemnity to anyone accused of enforced disappearances, murder, or other crimes against humanity, said a statement of the Inter Services Public Relations Directorate (ISPR) on Monday. Some dishonest and malicious groups especially individuals

item.title: Avalanche in Slovenia's Alps kills three Croatian climbers
item.description: Three Croatian climbers were killed after an avalanche struck below the Toska mountain peak in Slovenia’s Julian Alps on Sunday, rescuers said on Monday. The search for the trekkers, who went climbing despite weather warnings, began on Sunday when rescuers found the body of one of them befor
